Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

In a Euclidean domain with decidable equality, the greatest common divisor of any two elements divides the first element.

type: ∀ {R : Type u} [inst : EuclideanDomain R] [inst_1 : DecidableEq R] (a b : R), EuclideanDomain.gcd a b ∣ a
name: EuclideanDomain.gcd_dvd_left
docString: In a Euclidean domain with decidable equality, the greatest common divisor of any two elements divides the first element.

The theorem `Nat.gcd_dvd` states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of `m` and `n` is a divisor of both `m` and `n`. In other words, the GCD of two numbers divides each of the two numbers. This is a fundamental property of the GCD, typically denoted mathematically as $\text{gcd}(m, n) | m$ and $\text{gcd}(m, n) | n$.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), m.gcd n ∣ m ∧ m.gcd n ∣ n
name: Nat.gcd_dvd
docString: The theorem `Nat.gcd_dvd` states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of `m` and `n` is a divisor of both `m` and `n`. In other words, the GCD of two numbers divides each of the two numbers. This is a fundamental property of the GCD, typically denoted mathematically as $\text{gcd}(m, n) | m$ and $\text{gcd}(m, n) | n$.

Greatest common divisor of a multiset

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Multiset α → α
name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

The greatest common divisor of integers `a` and `b` divides `a`. In mathematical notation, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

type: ∀ {a b : ℤ}, ↑(a.gcd b) ∣ a
name: Int.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The greatest common divisor of integers `a` and `b` divides `a`. In mathematical notation, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

The theorem `Nat.gcd_div` states that for all natural numbers `m`, `n`, and `k`, if `k` divides `m` and `k` divides `n`, then the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m / k` and `n / k` is equal to the gcd of `m` and `n` divided by `k`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as: for all $m$, $n$, $k$ in $\mathbb{N}$, if $k | m$ and $k | n$, then $\gcd(\frac{m}{k}, \frac{n}{k}) = \frac{\gcd(m, n)}{k}$.

type: ∀ {m n k : ℕ}, k ∣ m → k ∣ n → (m / k).gcd (n / k) = m.gcd n / k
name: Nat.gcd_div
docString: The theorem `Nat.gcd_div` states that for all natural numbers `m`, `n`, and `k`, if `k` divides `m` and `k` divides `n`, then the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m / k` and `n / k` is equal to the gcd of `m` and `n` divided by `k`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as: for all $m$, $n$, $k$ in $\mathbb{N}$, if $k | m$ and $k | n$, then $\gcd(\frac{m}{k}, \frac{n}{k}) = \frac{\gcd(m, n)}{k}$.

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [self : GCDMonoid α] → α → α → α
name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

name: PNat.gcd
docString:
The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), Nat.divisors (m * n) = Nat.divisors m * Nat.divisors n
name: Nat.divisors_mul
docString:
The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] {a b c : α}, a ∣ c → a ∣ b → a ∣ gcd c b
name: GCDMonoid.dvd_gcd
docString: Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

type: ∀ {n d : ℕ}, d ∣ n → Nat.totient (n / d) = (Finset.filter (fun k => Nat.gcd n k = d) (Finset.range n)).card
name: Nat.totient_div_of_dvd
docString: For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ a
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

For ideals in a Dedekind domain, to divide is to contain.

type: ∀ {A : Type u_2} [inst : CommRing A] [inst_1 : IsDomain A] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain A] {I J : Ideal A}, I ∣ J ↔ J ≤ I
name: Ideal.dvd_iff_le
docString: For ideals in a Dedekind domain, to divide is to contain.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

The Kronecker delta as a locally constant map from `π C (· ∈ s)` to `ℤ`.

type:
{I : Type u} →
  [inst : LinearOrder I] →
    (C : Set (I → Bool)) →
      (s : Finset I) →
        ↑(Profinite.NobelingProof.π C fun x => x ∈ s) → LocallyConstant ↑(Profinite.NobelingProof.π C fun x => x ∈ s) ℤ
name: Profinite.NobelingProof.spanFinBasis
docString: The Kronecker delta as a locally constant map from `π C (· ∈ s)` to `ℤ`.

No zero divisors.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring α] {a b : α}, a * b = 0 → a = 0 ∨ b = 0

docString: No zero divisors.

In a Dedekind domain, the localization at every nonzero prime ideal is a DVR.

type:
∀ (A : Type u_2) [inst : CommRing A] [inst_1 : IsDomain A] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain A] {P : Ideal A},
  P ≠ ⊥ →
    ∀ [pP : Ideal.IsPrime P] (Aₘ : Type u_4) [inst_3 : CommRing Aₘ] [inst_4 : IsDomain Aₘ] [inst_5 : Algebra A Aₘ]
      [inst : IsLocalization.AtPrime Aₘ P], DiscreteValuationRing Aₘ
name: IsLocalization.AtPrime.discreteValuationRing_of_dedekind_domain
docString: In a Dedekind domain, the localization at every nonzero prime ideal is a DVR.

If an integer with larger absolute value divides an integer, it is
zero.

docString:
If an integer with larger absolute value divides an integer, it is
zero.

The Dirac delta distribution

type:
(𝕜 : Type u_1) →
  {E : Type u_4} →
    (F : Type u_5) →
      [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] →
        [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] →
          [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F] →
            [inst_3 : NormedSpace ℝ F] →
              [inst_4 : IsROrC 𝕜] →
                [inst_5 : NormedSpace 𝕜 F] → [inst_6 : SMulCommClass ℝ 𝕜 F] → E → SchwartzMap E F →L[𝕜] F
name: SchwartzMap.delta
docString: The Dirac delta distribution
